caseTitle: Ch. Zulfiqar Ali Ranjha and another v. Zia Ullah Ranjha and others
tagline: A ballot paper warrants out-right exclusion from the count if the signature as well as the official mark, both, are missing. In case only one of the two requirements exists and yet the final tally of votes cast at a polling station exceeds the number of ballot papers issued to the voters then too such ballot-papers should be excluded from the vote-count as excess of votes upon their count establishes that bogus voting has taken place.
